channel.title: How-to guides on WAHA
channel.description: Recent content in How-to guides on WAHA

item.title: 🔧 Install & Update
item.description: If you wish to follow a Step-By-Step guide which show you how to send you first message via HTTP API please go to ⚡ Quick Start.

item.title: 📊 Dashboard
item.description:
Dashboard is a UI to manage your WhatsApp sessions!

You can access Dashboard by running the project and opening http://localhost:3000/dashboard (or similar, but with /dashboard at the end).

item.title: 📚 Swagger (OpenAPI)
item.description:
Overview

The project provides HTTP API (REST), which is documented with OpenAPI specification and Swagger UI.

You can see all available endpoints, request/response examples, and even execute them directly from the Swagger UI.

item.title: 📤 Send messages
item.description:
We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code.

If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from ⚡ Quick Start.

item.title: 📥 Receive messages
item.description:
We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code.

If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from Quick Start →.

item.title: 🖥️ Sessions
item.description:
Overview

Session represents a WhatsApp Account (Phone Number) connected to WAHA that you can use to send and receive messages.

item.title: 🆔 Profile
item.description:
You can manage your WhatsApp profile with the following API!

Features

Here’s the list of features that are available by 🏭 Engines:

item.title: 🔄 Events
item.description:
In order to notify your application about events in the WhatsApp API, you can use Webhooks and Websockets.

👉 See the list of all available events in the Events section.

item.title: 🌐 Proxy
item.description:
Overview

If you’re experiencing issues scanning QR codes in WhatsApp, especially with Indian 🇮🇳 phone numbers, using a proxy located close to the phone number’s location may help resolve the problem.

item.title: 📶 Polls
item.description:
Waiting for WEBJS engine to support it, and we’ll add it ASAP!

Endpoints

See the list of engines that support the feature ->.
